title: Acknowledgement Letter
body: This letter is a clear agreement between you and the work you said you would do. It exists to remove debate, reduce friction, and make the next step obvious.
You are opening this app because you asked for structure. The point is not punishment. The point is that the work matters enough to be protected from avoidance and drift.
Read this fully. Sit with it. The seconds you spend here are the cost of entry for the hours you are about to invest in focused effort.
You do not need more motivation. You need a small, repeatable routine that starts the day the same way: read, acknowledge, begin.
If you are tempted to close this early, treat that impulse as the exact reason this exists. The friction is the feature, not the bug.
Focus is earned in the first few minutes. When you finish this letter, you are committing to a specific task, a specific window of time, and the patience to see it through.
Do the smallest meaningful unit of work next. Do not over design your plan. Act, then iterate once you are already in motion.
There is no penalty for slow progress, only for no progress. Start now, even if it feels imperfect.
By acknowledging below, you confirm that you have read this letter in full and accept the responsibility to proceed with focus and integrity.
When you close this app, you are not done. You are just starting. Move directly into your work with no detours.
closing: I have read this letter in full and I acknowledge it.
acknowledgementText: I acknowledge that I will begin now.
